results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Once up the stairs, turn around to your left, and go in the door that is mostly glass panes
results.name: Mindfulness Meditation

results.description:
Greetings and welcome to another meeting of the Manga Club! Please note that, due to popular demand, all meetings through the month of December will be held on Tuesdays instead of Mondays. If that works for everyone I will strive to make this a permanent change!

Usually around September, I try to do a title that reminds us of the Fall and, more importantly, the new school year. No matter how old you get, I believe that you should never forget that first day of school or, more importantly, that last day of summer vacation. That being said, I believe that there is more to learning then taking tests or catching a school bus. Therefore, let’s look at an alternative education as one boy apprentices to become the best baker in Japan in Yakitate!! Japan, Volume 1 and 2!

Yakitate!! Japan, Volume 1 and 2
by Takashi Hashiguchi

Azuma Kazuma, an energetic and dense young man, was introduced to the art of bread making when he was six. He decides to take the path of bread-making and become a baker right after graduating from middle school. Through his travels, he encounters many rivals and found work at the branch store of the most famous bread maker brand, the Phantasia.

A limited number of copies are available at the venue, and don’t forget our special deal! On the night of the Manga Club, all participants get ten percent off all graphic novels in the store, and twenty five percent off any future Manga Club title releases in stock! So if you come to the July Manga Club event, you can get the August or September titles for twenty five percent off as available!

BUT PLEASE REMEMBER, THIS DISCOUNT ONLY APPLIES TO VOLUMES IN THE STORE ON THE NIGHT OF A MANGA CLUB EVENT! THIS DISCOUNT DOES NOT APPLY AT ANY OTHER TIME OR TO A PREVIOUSLY RESERVED GRAPHIC NOVEL! THIS DEAL IS A GIFT NOT A PRIVILEGE SO PLEASE DO NOT ABUSE IT!

Thank you and I hope to see you there!

results.description:
Women, would you like to:

• Experience a more loving, pleasurable relationship with your body and your sexuality.

• Be empowered with greater understanding of what you need to awaken your desire.

• Feel lighter, more hopeful, more alive, more vibrant and more loving.

• Be more confident, more relaxed, more comfortable in your skin, more beautiful, more radiant, softer and more open.

• Feel connected to and supported by a circle of sisters.

• Treat yourself, your family, your friends and your coworkers more kindly.


My Gift to You

In this special teleconference you will have the opportunity to reflect on your relationship with your body, your sexuality and your spirit. You will be guided in some meditations and exercises to connect with your heart’s desire and identify what is blocking you from realizing it. I will share with you insights from my journey of sexual healing and awakening and lay out the most efficient path to healing that which is blocking you from reclaiming your innate aliveness, passion and pleasure.

I will introduce the Six Main Elements of the Venus Rising: Women's Sexual Empowerment Weekend (Nov 6-8) and be sure to leave time to have your questions answered.

Access Info: Those who have RSVPed by 7:30pm 9/29 will receive the access code to the live event. Those who RSVP after 8pm will receive the link to the recording by the following morning.

Hope to see you there!

Much love,

Brynn

results.description:
Ongoing class in 18th century Scottish Broadsword and Smallsword.


The Broadsword is the archetypal weapon of the Highlander swordsman - a broad-bladed cutting and thrusting weapon. It has a basket hilt to protect the hand and wielded single-handed.

The Smallsword is the courtly weapon of the Scottish warrior class. An elegant thrusting weapon it teaches the fighter to use the thrust and make small parries. The smallsword is the immediate predecessor to modern epee.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
results.name: Scottish Broadsword & Smallsword

results.description:
It is a common misconception that "good ideas" are what makes a business fail or succeed. In reality, a good idea is just the starting point and the execution is what really matters.

At this weeks marketing meeting, we will go over the blueprint for turning ideas into reality and the software that we use in order to help us accomplish this.

Specific Topics Include:

1. The software that we use in order to help us turn an idea into a series of actionable steps

2. The process necessary to get from an idea to a plan of action

3. Examples of some of my action plans that I created that started from one simple idea

4. Tips and tricks on executing your plan of action
results.name: The Blueprint For Turning Ideas Into Reality

results.description:
Animal Farm: A Talk by Farm Sanctuary President and Founder Gene Baur - Event link HERE. 

Note: The CMF reminds members that there is absolutely no scientific evidence that a vegan diet is beneficial to humans; nor is there any basis for veganism in ecology, economics or any other discipline. Indeed, veganism, if practiced more broadly, would have devastating consequences for the environment (not to mention the world's rich diversity of cultures) ... just so you know. - §

:: :: ::

Hear Farm Sanctuary's president and founder, Gene Baur, discuss his national animal rescue organization. TIME Magazine hailed Gene Baur as “the conscience of the food movement.” For 25 years, Gene has traveled extensively, campaigning to raise awareness about the abuses of industrialized factory farming and our cheap food system. His latest book, published by Rodale, Living the Farm Sanctuary Life: The Ultimate Guide to Eating Mindfully, Living Longer, and Feeling Better Every Day, is available for sale. 


His previous bestseller, Farm Sanctuary: Changing Hearts and Minds About Animals and Food, was published by Touchstone in March 2008. 

Lunch provided by Grasshopper Vegan Restaurant. If you or another participant needs disability-related accommodations, contact Accessibility Services at the Dean of Students Office, WCC 3039, at [masked] or[masked] before the event. 

Sponsored by Harvard Law School Student Animal Legal Defense Fund. 

Sponsor: Harvard Law School Student Animal Legal Defense Fund. 

Speaker(s): Gene Baur, president and founder of Farm Sanctuary. 

Free and open to the public. Wednesday, September 30, Noon. 

Harvard Law School, Pound Hall, Room 102, 1563 Massachusetts Avenue. 

For more info visit <a>www.facebook.com.</a>

Welcome back Digital Humanists! Let's kick off a semester of events by getting together for a brown bag lunch and meet-and-greet. We will also have a quick demo of a crowd-sourced Archaeological Digital Humanities project -- The Levantine Ceramics Project (http://www.levantineceramics.org) -- that has been "live in production" since 2012 with an ever-growing collection of data and users. 

Where:

Boston University, 675 Commonwealth Avenue, Room 326

Boston, MA

Wednesday September 30th, 2015 at 12pm

What to bring:

Yourself, a brown bag lunch for yourself, and a desire to meet fellow Digital Humanists!

What to expect:

A friendly gathering of scholars and technologists, and a "behind-the-scenes" look at the Levantine Ceramics Project (http://www.levantineceramics.org)

Thanks to:
Professor Andrea Berlin at BU for letting us use the room at BU.

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share'
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 
TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

Vegan Cooking Classes or  
Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food
(using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 


What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag? Portion Control Bake...Don't Fry! Roasted Veggie Stackers No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream Avocados!!! Salad with Chipotle Hummus Simple Cilantro Chutney More $2 bags of Produce! Drink your greens!

results.description:
Join the MIT Media Lab’s Engineering Health group as they kick-off the academic year with an exciting new innovation series as a part of the Engineering Health Class. The first Health Night this Fall is on Wednesday, Sept 30th from 5-7 pm in the Media Lab E14-240.

Come enjoy food and drink while learning about the Media Lab’s approach to rapid prototyping medical technology and meet fellow physician-innovators in the Boston community. Prof. Ramesh Raskar and his lab have been working on low cost cutting edge technology for several years both domestically and in India. However, we want to learn more from you about the frustrations and innovative solutions of doctors from all specialties to inspire our engineers and students to dive into new exciting problems. 

What to expect:
(i) A kick off with 3x3 (3 mins, 3 slides) presentations of health tech research (YOU are welcome to present or send a scientist. Submit your topic title asap.)
(ii) Wish list items from health professionals in the 3x3 format
(iii) Break-out sessions: teams work in parallel in refining the problems and solutions
(iv) If you are a physician, become a Meddit Fellow to get your dream problem solved by engineers!
results.how_to_find_us: Room E14-240
results.name: Fall Health Nights are back!

group.name: ReDX: The Boston Health Technology Meetup

results.description:
Hi All!
A number of you have shown interest in a weekday evening meetup in the downtown Boston area. Here it is! Please come and join us for a casual 2 hours ASL social on Wednesdays from 5:30 to 7:30 pm.


WHO: All who are interested in ASL are welcome to join us. Whether you're Deaf or hearing, beginner or fluent ASL user, we're here to share and socialize in this beautiful language.

WHERE: We'll be in the City Place Food Court in Dept of Transportation Building (use entrance on Boylston Street across street from Boylston Street T stop or entrance on Stuart Street) . Since we'll most likely be the only group of people signing, we should be pretty easy to spot.

RULES: Voices off, use paper and pen if you need to--this helps us learn and its Deaf friendly


RESOURCES: For those of you who are new to ASL and want to come prepared, here are some very good websites with free online classes.

http://www.westwoodasl.com/ http://www.lifeprint.com/ http://www.start-american-sign-language.com/

RSVP: Please RSVP for the meetup that you will be attending so we know how many people to expect.

CONTACT: Please feel free to contact host (Sean) if you have any questions or concerns. Hope to see you there! :)

results.description:
How do we engage with critics in a way that pushes everyone towards truth? Truly rational agents must converge to truth (by Aumann's Agreement Theorem). But how do we strive for the rationalist habit of seeking to update our beliefs instead of the very human habit of seeking to confirm our existing beliefs? We want to "steel-man" opposing arguments, give them serious consideration, and generally create a tone where participants are rewarded for updating their beliefs.

We'll have a discussion and play a game inspired by the ideological Turing test.

Julia Galef has a great video on handling moral disagreements.

Our usual schedule is

• 5:30-6pm Welcome everyone and discuss progress  on goals from last week. Order drinks and appetizers or dinner.

• 6-7:00pm Focused discussion and work on our topic for the week. In addition to discussion of the theory, we really want to do exercises and make progress on real problems.

• 7-7:30pm Conclude and set individual goals for next meeting

• 7:30-... Chat, mingle and leave whenever

Please bring something to write with and on.

results.name: Having Productive Discussions

results.description:
A daughter of freed African American slaves, Daisy Turner [masked]) became a living repository of history. The family narrative entrusted to her—"a well-polished artifact, an heirloom that had been carefully preserved"—began among the Yoruba in West Africa and represented four generations of family history. In 1983 folklorist Jane Beck met Turner and spent three years recording her family story. From these interviews came a video, “On My Own,” and a Peabody award winning radio series, “Journey’s End: The Memories and Traditions of Daisy Turner and her Family.” In her most recent work, Daisy Turner’s Kin: An African American Family Saga (University of Illinois Press, 2015), Beck combines Turner's storytelling with historical research to build and authenticate a family saga. Join the author to learn more about Daisy Turner and her family’s stories—from the abduction into slavery of Turner’s African ancestors to Daisy's father learning to read; Daisy's childhood stand against racism to her family's life in Vermont—and gain a better understanding of the hazards and uses of memory through a folklorist’s perspective. Book sales and signing to follow.

Register today! at NEHGS

Maybe a bite to eat and conversation afterward - specific to African-American genealogy or the book event?
results.name: Book Event: Daisy Turner’s Kin: An African American Family Saga

results.description:
Momentum trading is one of the first things that many people think of when approaching quantitative finance. The idea is that investors will prefer to buy stocks that have been performing well, driving prices still higher, and will shy away from stocks with recent price drops, leading to less demand and further price decay. It is an intuitive way of modeling asset prices, and works in some cases. 

In this lecture we will discuss how to determine if a momentum model is appropriate for a given case, and ways to use that model to execute trades.

This talk is part of Quantopian’s Lecture Series. All lecture materials can be found at: www.quantopian.com/lectures.

Pizza and beverages will be provided by Quantopian.

Speaker Details:

Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie is an engineer at Quantopian who focuses on how Quantopian can be used as a teaching tool. 

After studying computer science at Princeton, Delaney joined Quantopian in 2014. Since then he has led successful course integrations at MIT Sloan and Stanford, and is working with over 20 courses for this fall. Delaney is using his experience and feedback from professors to build a quantitative finance curriculum focusing on best statistical practices to be offered for free. Delaney’s background includes 7 years of academic research at a bioinformatics lab, and a strong focus on statistics and machine learning.
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance is on Arch Street. We are on the 5th floor.
results.name: How to Build a Momentum Based Trading Strategy

results.description:
This month we have two presentations.

• Directions

-----------

HTML5 & JavaScript End User Monitoring


- Rob Ide and David DiGangi

The explosion of JavaScript frameworks and the diversity of devices and browser types to support make it difficult to impossible to determine how your application is behaving in the wild. This presentation will focus on using the AppDynamics' End User Monitoring to monitor how HTML5 and JavaScript are performing and behaving in real world deployments." 

-----------

An Overview of GruntJS - Gary Chamberlain

Use Grunt to automate just about anything with a minimum of effort. The less work you have to do when performing repetitive tasks like minification, compilation, unit testing, linting, etc, the easier your job becomes. After you've configured it through a Gruntfile, a task runner can do most of that mundane work for you—and your team—with basically zero effort.

-----------

Pizza and drinks will be served courtesy of AppDynamics.

The AppDynamics Application Intelligence Platform helps today's software-defined businesses proactively monitor, manage, analyze and optimize the most complex software environments, providing real-time, actionable IT operational and business insights into application performance, user experience, and business outcomes — all in real time, and all in production. With cloud, on-premises, and hybrid deployment flexibility, AppDynamics works and partners with many of the world's most innovative companies. Customers include Edmunds, Expedia, OpenTable, HBO, Salesforce.com, Sephora, StubHub, and Union Pacific Railroad. For more information, visit www.appdynamics.com.

results.description:
Want to learn Public Speaking but not sure where to start?

Afraid of speaking in front of groups, use filler words like 'um', have no idea how to structure an interesting speech? Then this is the place for you.

This experiential class will give you a safe, supportive and fun atmosphere to practice public speaking with your peers who are also your supportive audience.


Let the President of Toastmasters Boston Copley share with you the basics of solid speech making.

Fear?  Not to worry...you'll learn the coping mechanisms the professionals use and the fear will turn to excitement!


Learn how to give a speech without notes and never forget what to say!


How about getting rid of those pesky 'ums', 'likes', 'you knows' and other filler words?  That's part of the class.


Have a specific project or presentation?  Practice it in this class.  


Our small classes are designed to give you the individual attention, feedback and suggestions to help you thrive!

Session 1 is a mix of lecture/instruction and actual practice.  

With small classes I custom design the lecture to your specific goals such as giving a Ted Talk, a company presentation, or even a speech at a wedding.

And we have a 100% money back guarantee.  If you feel it's not worth your money you get a 100% refund.  No questions asked.

See you there!

results.description:
The 4th quarterly free learning event of the Boston Area Talent Sourcing Association (BATSA) is coming soon, and you'll definitely want to click the green Register button above for this one before seats run out! We are pleased to announce our keynoter will be Boston's own Matthew MacDonald, Americas Sourcing Manager of SAP, one of the world's largest business software firms.  Matt is a lead innovator of what has been called by SourceCon and many others to be among the most robust and successful implementations of internal gamification of a talent sourcing team's activities. What is gamification?  In short, it's applying competitive aspects of games and the related awards and psychology to improve business results. An increasingly popular concept in recent years, not many examples applied to recruiting were publicly documented.  But SAP did so with their initiative in an ERE post in April 2015 that Matt co-authored, and they've continued to evolve and improve it. Whether you're attending SourceCon Dallas in Sept. or not (though we'd highly encourage it!), we're giving Matt more presentation time locally at BATSA so he can go into more depth about how gamification made his sourcing team more productive and how it ties into their other sourcing systems, and how you can do the same in your organization with little or no budget! 

WHERE & WHEN:

This event will be held at Constant Contact's HQ in Waltham.  Use on-site free parking lots at 1601 Trapelo Rd., Waltham, MA and proceed to the 2nd floor.  PRE-REGISTRATION REQUIRED to guarantee your free seat - space is limited.

 6pm-6:30pm: Registration & Refreshments (bring a printout of your free e-ticket or use the free EventBrite mobile app to present at the door to speed your access) 6:30pm-7:00pm: Peer-to-Peer Networking Groups on several hot sourcing topics 7:00pm-8:00pm: Keynote presentation on Sourcing Gamification by Matt MacDonald, SAP 8:00pm-8:15pm: open Q&A with our keynoter 8:15pm-9:00pm: Sourcing Guru Tips: "Candidate Engagement: Going from 0 to 60 in 300 Seconds" by KC Donovan. In all of sourcing, the area that gets the least attention but is the most important, is making use of your hard-won contact information by picking up the phone and successfully engaging with your prospect live... Grabbing their attention is one thing, but breaking through the clutter to get your message across is an art that can be learned. We'll map out the steps of how to go from ringing phone to a top-performing prospect spilling their story...all in the first five minutes of your call.  PLEASE THANK OUR EVENT SPONSOR Avature and event host Constant Contact

What is BATSA?

Our volunteer-led association's mission is to promote Sourcing as a respected function and career path within the recruiting and competitive intelligence industries, teach tricks of the trade to aspiring professionals, and encourage interaction among Sourcing practitioners and leaders to foster dissemination of best practices in the greater Boston area (inclusive of MA, RI and NH). 

Have questions about Turbocharge Your Sourcing Team with Sourcification? Contact BATSA - Boston Area Talent Sourcing Association
results.name: Turbocharge Your Sourcing Team with Sourcification

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE HERE (and RSVP on the meetup too, please) : https://authenticman.isrefer.com/go/ros-boston/melodyindigo/

How many conversations do you have each day? 10? 20? 100? From intimate partners to cashiers at the store, from gym friends to business partners, our lives consist of opportunities to be effective in relating to each other.

Each of these moments are opportunities not only to make plans or share information, but also to feel connected, to see and be seen, and to enrich the lives of those we come into contact with (including ourselves).

Sounds juicy, right?

Join me, Melody Indigo Markel as I lead you through a two-hour Authentic Relating experience that will give you:

-New skill in drawing out open, honest communication from others and having them feel fully at ease in your presence 

-Knowledge of the three types of conversations, and facility in navigating among them to create different kinds of connections 

- The main reason why so many conversations are dull and lifeless, and how to instantly inspire vitality 

-The structures that have people want to listen to and remember your every word

Where: 144 Moody St., Building 4, Waltham, MA
When: Wednesday, September 30 from 6:30-8:30pm
Cost: $20 at the door or FREE if you pre-register here:
https://authenticman.isrefer.com/go/ros-boston/melodyindigo/

Parking instructions: http://jonfischerphotography.smugmug.com/JFP-1/Studio-Parking/

About The Leader

Melody Indigo Markel is a men's and life coach from Boulder, CO. She serves on faculty at The Integral Center, helping to offer a variety of courses centered around human connection and relational intelligence. She believes nothing is sexier than exposing what’s true in the present moment, and is thrilled to be taking some of what she's learned so far on the road.
results.name: Transformational Conversations

Please mark September 30th, 6:30pm-10pm on your calendars for the Nubia Williams RTW Launch Party for Boston Fashion Week at the Artists for Humanity Epicenter! This is the debut show for this Parsons School of Design graduate and current adjunct Pre-College fashion professor at Lesley University College of Art and Design. Williams successfully raised funds through her "Nubia Comes to Boston" Kickstarter Campaign and will be using these funds to hire young emerging talent from Artists for Humanity and Empire Beauty School for photography, hair and makeup. Accessories will be provided by Boutikey, a Boston boutique carrying emerging designers. Williams aims to inspire the youth to make their creativity profitable and provide the professional/educational opportunities to do so.

For this collection, Williams will be taking you on a cultural journey to Ancient Nubia, the neglected and fading culture who's pyramids will soon be part of an underwater Atlantis, engulfed by its own Nile river. This culture will be illustrated through both conceptual and Ready-to-Wear fashion. You can expect good music, savory bites, raffles, gift bags, and most importantly, a FABULOUS runway show. A night you won't want to miss! Let's all get together and support emerging talent!

Tickets are now on sale at(All must RSVP on Eventbrite prior to the event): https://nubiawilliamsbostonfashionweek.eventbrite.com

You can view Williams' story at: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/332535833/nubia-comes-to-boston?ref=video
results.name: Nubia Williams Launch Party at Boston Fashion Week 2015

ONE SPOT LEFT!

***As this event is advertised in several venues and tends to fill up attendees MUST email/pre-pay [masked] to reserve their specific time slot in the clinic. Thank you!


Did you know that women have an additional level to their energetic system that men do not! 

The female body holds tremendous creative power and an amazing (often unknown!) ability to attract and hold energy. This power can be used to create our dreams and goals in big and abundant ways--be it a child, a business, wealth, artistic projects, or taking care of a home and family. However, female energy can often become depleted or unbalanced--which is reflected in our lives as chronic guilt, anxiety, depression, poor health and vitality, and lack of fulfillment.

A Female Energy Healing rebalances your female creative energy to replenish your physical and emotional health and move you out of worry and effort into relaxation and ease.

Cost: $40 and Healings last approximately 25-30 minutes.

Jill Alexander holds a Master’s degree from Lesley University in Energy Medicine. She has done energy work in hospitals, doctor's offices, and practice.  Jill is a graduate of The Clairvoyant Center of Hawaii and has 15 years of training in energy work.



.

results.description:
Most Wednesdays we gather for an open gaming night at the Panera in Porter Square. This event is open to anyone, and usually doesn't have any sort of pre-arranged agenda -- anything you can bring is fair game, provided you can get it done in three hours!

* Your gallant host almost always brings something to play, and takes requests if you get said request to him by Tuesday night at the latest. Behold the collection: http://www.bgg.cc/collection/user/CmdrOverbite?gallery=large&rankobjecttype=subtype&rankobjectid=1&columns=title%7Cstatus%7Cversion%7Crating%7Cbggrating%7Cplays%7Ccomment%7Ccommands&geekranks=%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09Board+Game+Rank%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09&own=1&objecttype=thing&ff=1&subtype=boardgame

* Due to logistical concerns and a desire to keep peace with the management (who have been notably chill thus far about a bunch of freeloading nerds taking up their table space), I have set a limit of twelve attendees on these events going forward. I doubt this will be much of an issue, given our typical attendance numbers.

* Because our events tend to be small, and the games we typically play tend to be long, if at all possible, please let us know if you plan to be more than a couple of minutes late so that we don't launch into something without you. Likewise, if you're planning on arriving more than a half-hour late, you should be aware that it may not be possible to include you in a game. You're welcome to come by and hang out but the chances are better than even that we'll be hip-deep in gaming goodness by the time you arrive.

* Please be respectful of our hosts; stay mindful of closing time and throw 'em some business if you're hungry.

* Have fun and roll high!

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we meet to discuss Chapters 23 & 24 of Keynes' "General Theory", as well as Chapters 23 & 24 of Hazlitt's line-by-line critique of "Failure of the New Economics." The readings are not required to attend our meeting, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

PLEASE NOTE:  This meeting will take place at a new location; Tony C's Sports Bar and Grill in Somerville, which has a parking lot and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop. 

READINGS:


"The General Theory of Employment, Interest, and Money"
by J.M. Keynes
Chapters 23 & 24
http://bit.ly/1QDOIeY

"The Failure of the New Economics"
by Henry Hazlitt
Chapters 23 & 24
http://bit.ly/1RKJIZk


QUESTIONS:

1. Did Keynes always believe in mercantilism?

2. According to Keynes, to whom do the advantages of mercantilism accrue? What does Keynes say is a danger of pursuing a favorable balance of trade?

3. According to Hazlitt, why do mercantilist policies (esp. protection) tend to injure the country pursuing such policies the most?

4. What does Keynes say about the effect of post-World War I protectionism in Europe? What does he propose for countries with the aim of “restoring economic health and strength internationally”?

5. What does Keynes think of usury? What is his justification for laws against it?

6. Hazlitt cites John Stuart Mill as a refutation of Keynes' spending theories. What is Mill's criticism?

7. What does Keynes mean by “euthanasia of the rentier”?

8. Keynes describes “the rentier aspect of capitalism as a transitional phase which will disappear when it has done its work”. How does this parallel Marxism?

9. What does Keynes think are the causes of war?

10. What does Keynes say about the power of ideas?
results.how_to_find_us: The reservation is under our Director of Event's name, Natalya Orlando.  She can be reached @ 774-284-0420.
results.name: MERCANTILISM, USURY AND UNDER-CONSUMPTION THEORY

results.description:
Mineral deficiency is rampant in our society – contributing to a whole host of chronic and acute illnesses. Depleted soils mean that our fruits and vegetables don’t have the same mineral content that they once had. To make things worse, we no longer favor mineral-rich foods in our diets: organ meats, seaweed, and bone broths are not exactly staples in most families’ menus. They should be, because mineral rich broths and soups are important nutritive remedies in every traditional healing system.
Grandma knows this, which is why she would always make her special, from scratch, chicken soup when we got sick. Full of onions, garlic, thyme, sage, oregano and chicken, cooked in a base of mineral rich chicken broth. Her soup is packed with nutrition, immune support, and antimicrobial plants; just the thing we need when feeling under the weather.

In this class, come join us as we learn how to make a basic bone broth, and turn that broth into all kinds of soups, stews, and other recipes. Find out where to get good quality bones, how to cook them up, and why bone broths are one of the most important-yet-forgotten foods that we should be eating daily. The fee for this class is $20.
RSVP by emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.
results.name: Herbal and Nourishing Broths - Pre-Registration Required

results.description:
Murray Denofsky will introduce people to some of the interesting aspects of Chinese that differ from European languages. We will examine pronunciation (including tones), spelling, word structure, and grammar.


Chinese has virtually no affixes or alterations of any kind that can be made to a word; it's grammar is fully clear from word order alone. Every syllable has a meaning, and compound words are composed of these monosyllabic 'words'.

As the group has not been large enough to reserve a space for, we are meeting at a regular restaurant table in an inexpensive health food restaurant. We may retire to a nearby coffee shop later.
results.name: Unusual aspects of the Chinese language

results.description:
Can short format films be the start of something bigger and better?  Or are they an often under-appreciated art form in their own right? Three women filmmakers will present their award-winning, innovative shorts and discuss what inspired them and how this format can lead to other projects of varying lengths and topics.

Featured:

At The Line directed by Sari Gagnon -- A lesbian couple struggle over whether to stay in the closet or come out and jeopardize their careers in college basketball. This short is part of a feature length play of the same title, written by Lynne S. Brandon, produced by Rita Pirozkhov and created in collaboration with the Women Only Project. http://gagnonsari.wix.com/sarigagnon


After Ella written and directed by Marie Emmanuelle Hartness --  selected for the Short Film Corner at the Cannes International Film Festival & finalist from New England in Women in Film International contest. Hope, a photographer, begins receiving texts messages from her sister Ella.  There is only one issue -- she is recently deceased. http://www.maiema.com/

Am I Not Your Girl? written and directed by Sara X Robin premiered at the 2014 Berlin Independent Film Festival, and has been shown in Film Festivals in over a dozen countries.  On the morning of her wedding, Lena wonders if it can possibly be worth it, given all of the difficulties. http://saraxrobin.com/

Free parking behind building, food and beverages for sale

Donation $20.00 for non-members $15.00 for WIFV members and members of co-sponsor Harvard Square Script Writers

Introductory All-Student Rate $10.00
results.name: The Long & the Short of It  Screening & Panel Discussion

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11

results.description:
Join 50 to 80 or 100 dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 44 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily, and get in for half price! Otherwise, you decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in funk, rock, salsa, modern, jazz, hip-hop, African & Latin and swing, tango, contact improvisation, and our own unique spontaneous creations! Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop (or chatting & stretching in a way that doesn't interfere), then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, everyone who wants to gathers around a centerpiece to hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together to a song with uplifting, connective (or at least beautiful and hypnotic) slow to medium tempo rhythms. (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better and be serviceful, as well as to save money and help us to be around for another 42 years... Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]

Should be able to have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please do the following: Click RSVP or send an email to Alan using the following URL:

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] | Home Page:

http://www.jccns.org/adult-volleyball/

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $10 membership fee that is valid for a day. As always, please remember: - Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP) - If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join. results.description:
Want to be a super Public Speaker?  

This experiential class will give you a safe, supportive and fun atmosphere to practice public speaking in multiple formats with a supportive audience.


Session 2 focusses on YOU practicing speaking and getting constructive feedback and coaching from me and your peers.

Not sure what to say?  We give you easy speech topics to practice.

Let the President of Toastmasters Boston Copley share all the tricks of the trade for you to thrive in any speaking environment.

Learn how to give a speech without notes and never forget what to say!

How about getting rid of those pesky 'ums', 'likes', 'you knows' and other filler words?


Fear?  Not to worry...you'll learn the coping mechanisms the professionals use and the fear will turn to excitement!

Have a specific project or presentation?  Do it in this class.  

Our small classes are designed to give you the individual attention, feedback and suggestions to help you thrive!

And we have a 100% money back guarantee.  If you feel it's not worth your money you get a 100% refund.  No questions asked.

See you there!

Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
